perturbation.original_text:
3. Non-Solicitation. Section 4 of the Non-Competition Agreement is hereby deleted in its entirety and replaced with
the following:
“Term. This Agreement will become effective on the Effective Date, and will continue until the expiration of the “Sales
Term” as that term is defined in the Sales Dealer Agreement dated as of August 16, 2017 between Vivint and Vivint Solar
Developer, LLC (the “Term”).”
perturbation.changed_text:
3. Non-Solicitation. Section 4 of the Non-Competition Agreement is hereby deleted in its entirety and replaced with
the following:
“Term. This Agreement will become effective on the Effective Date, and will continue for a period of two (2) years from the Effective Date (the "Term").”
perturbation.explanation: The original text defines the term based on the 'Sales Term' of another agreement. The modified text defines it as a fixed two-year period. This creates a contradiction because the 'Sales Term' in the other agreement might extend beyond or end before the two-year period, creating uncertainty about the non-solicitation term's actual duration and enforceability.

perturbation.original_text:
4.	Continuation.
This Amendment will apply and be effective only with respect to the provisions of the Non-
Competition Agreement specifically referred to herein. Except as otherwise set forth in this Amendment, the Non-Competition
Agreement will continue in full force and effect in accordance with its terms.
perturbation.changed_text:
4.	Continuation.
This Amendment will apply and be effective only with respect to the provisions of the Non-
Competition Agreement specifically referred to herein. Notwithstanding the above, any clause in the original agreement that conflicts with this amendment will be superseded. Except as otherwise set forth in this Amendment, the Non-Competition
Agreement will continue in full force and effect in accordance with its terms.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states that the Non-Competition Agreement continues in full force and effect. The modified text adds a clause that *any clause that conflicts with this amendment will be superseded*. This statement introduces a degree of uncertainty as to which parts of the original agreement are still valid in light of the amendment and could cause conflicts if the amendment itself has any ambiguities.

perturbation.original_text:
5.	Master Framework Agreement. This Amendment is governed by the Master Framework Agreement, including,
without limitation, the provisions of Sections 4 (Confidentiality) and 6 (Miscellaneous) of the Master Framework Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text:
5.	Master Framework Agreement. This Amendment is governed by the Master Framework Agreement, including,
without limitation, the provisions of Sections 4 (Confidentiality) and 6 (Miscellaneous) of the Master Framework Agreement. However, in case of a dispute, this agreement will take precedence.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause defers to the Master Framework Agreement. The addition stating 'in case of a dispute, this agreement will take precedence' creates ambiguity because it is unclear which aspects of the Master Framework Agreement are superseded, leading to potential conflicts about interpretation and enforcement. For instance, dispute resolution mechanisms described in the Master Framework Agreement may now be questioned.
